intro: Phanera nakhonphanomensis, commonly known as the Nakhonphanom phanera, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale pink or white. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
